original_title: Gurumbé: canciones de tu memoria negra
overview: Once the commercial exploitation of the resources existing in the American provinces of the Hispanic Monarchy began, hundreds of Africans were enslaved. Those who remained in Spain ended up forming a community that, over time, managed to gain a small space in society. Music and dance helped to strengthen their identity.
title: Gurumbé: Afro-Andalusian Memories
